title: Summer Placements - Corporate IT
description:
IT Summer Placements - Corporate IT

Duration: 12 weeks commencing June 2024

Location: see below for each placement

Salary: Circa £23,422 per annum pro rata

What is the role?

We have ambitious net zero targets, and our business is growing to help us achieve our strategy. We're looking for students who can bring fresh ideas, new skills and creative thinking, to deliver innovative solutions to help us reach net zero. This is an exciting time to join SSE, you have the power to make a change and help us build a better, more sustainable world of energy for you, your family, the community you live in and for generations to come.

What do I need?

We have opportunities for those studying degrees inclusive of software development and/or technology innovation. Please see each placement for the degree discipline, year group and location.

We'd love you to have some practical work or project experience that reflects your passion for the energy sector, as well as demonstrable experience of working in a team. You'll also be comfortable working to and setting stretching individual targets and using your own initiative to overcome challenges and should have a genuine interest in SSE and the prospect of a long-term future with us.

About our Business

SSE IT underpins the technology needs of all the different businesses that make up the SSE group. From emerging technologies to data and analytics to cyber security - we power SSE's growth and enable it to generate value, while keeping it secure. As a trusted business partner that helps SSE lead in a low carbon world, we are proud of our service. Working for SSE IT is all about equipping SSE for now and the future.

Emerging Technology Team: Software Developer

Location–remote but able to reach Havant, Reading, London or Perth for regular meetings once or twice a month

Degree discipline: Software Engineering / Computer Science / Engineering (would also consider Data and AI/Analytics/Machine Learning/ Data Science) preferred year of study: Year 2 or 3

The Emerging Technologies Team is a small team tasked with exploring new technologies such as Mixed Reality, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Internet of Things (IoT) and the Metaverse. They embrace a mixture of programming languages, tools, and platforms to deliver this capability.

You will participate in assessing the feasibility, capabilities, process and operability of new technologies, techniques, and products.

You will assist in re-purposing existing technologies, techniques, and products and assist in building proof of concepts.

You will be involved in elements of analysis, programming / software development, system design, database design and research.

This is a great opportunity for a motivated individual eager to learn and be at the forefront of emerging technologies.

Cyber Resilience Team - Distribution TD&D - Analyst

Location–remote but able to reach Havant, Reading, London or Perth for regular meetings once or twice a month

Degree discipline: Computer Studies (or similar) preferred year of study: final

Working in the Cyber Security Programme, conduct a study on the varying education requirements for cyber security across the Distribution workforce, and suggest appropriate learning methods and ways to measure their effectiveness.

Energy Customer Solutions IT - IT Architecture Support

Location - Reading or Dublin

Degree discipline: Computer Studies, Computer Science - preferred year of study any

The IT Architecture Support role is responsible for assisting the IT Architecture team in delivering and maintaining the IT architecture vision, roadmap, and baseline for the organization. The role involves working closely with the IT Architecture Lead and other IT architects to manage the architecture backlog, ensure alignment with the strategic roadmap, and produce high-quality architecture deliverables and visions. It also includes involves collaborating across the multiple disciplines of IT Architecture, such as Data, Security, and Technology.

The main duties of the IT Architecture support role include; Architecture Backlog Management, Baseline Management, Strategic Roadmap, Architecture Deliverables and Visions and stakeholder management responsibilities.

What's in it for you?

An excellent package with 34 days holiday entitlement - pro rata, discounted gym memberships and much more, view our full benefits package on our careers site.

As an equal opportunity employer we encourage diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We actively encourage applicants from all protected characteristics and commit to providing any reasonable adjustments required during the application, assessment and upon joining SSE. Search for ‘Inclusion & Diversity at SSE’ to find out more.

Next Steps

All applications should be submitted online. The closing date is 11pm on Sunday, 25th February.

If you would like to discuss any working differently requirements or adjustments you may require throughout the recruitment and selection process, please contact graduates@sse.com by email or you are very welcome to request a call if you would prefer to discuss on the phone.

Before commencing employment with SSE, you’ll be required to fully complete our pre-employment screening process consisting of a basic criminal records and credit check. title: Project Manager
description:
About the Role

Base Location: Aberdeen, Inverness or Perth

Salary: £45,400 - £68,200 + car /car allowance + performance-related bonus + a range of benefits to support your finances, wellbeing and family.

Working Pattern: Permanent | Full Time | Flexible First options available

The Eastern Green Link Programme is a multi-billion pound Programme currently comprised of two projects (Eastern Green Link 2 enters execution and Eastern Green Link 3 is pre construction), both of which are being delivered via Joint Venture with National Grid. Both projects are focusing on the development of Eastern HVDC Subsea Links which will connect Scotland and England to support the transfer of renewable electricity to key UK centres of demand. This will be the largest programme of work that SSEN Transmission will be involved in over the next decade.

The key duties and responsibilities of the Project Manager – Digital Services are:

  • Drive the definition and design of a holistic 'To-be' Operating Model for SSENT and NGET Joint Ventures, covering systems, processes and people.
  • Support the development and maintenance of an 'As-Is' systems architecture, which clearly articulates how both organisations are integrated.
  • Develop and rollout a delivery roadmap, which clearly articulates how the 'To-Be' integrated Operating Model will be designed and implemented, including Change Management deliverables.
  • Engage support functions (including IT) within both organisations to understand their current delivery roadmap and factor in Eastern Green Link project requirements and identify any project capability gaps and work with the project team and support functions to design and implement acceptable interim solutions.
  • Support the Head of Project Services in ensuring the Joint Venture Operating Model meets all Regulatory, IT Security etc. requirements, as defined by both parent organisations and drive alignment with internal governance processes and ensure any Operating Model solutions are signed off by relevant stakeholders.

What do I need?

To be considered for this role, we would love you to have:

  • Strong Project Management experience, particularly with an IT/systems focus and experience of Agile methodologies.
  • Experience in the design and implementation of large scale operating models.
  • Experience within the Transmission industry.
  • Strong stakeholder and communications experience and proven ability to manage multi-disciplinary teams (e.g. solution architects, IT Security).
  • Ability to work in fast paced environments, to pressurised deadlines and ability to navigate uncertain/changing requirements.

About our Business

SSEN Transmission owns and operates the electricity transmission network in the north of Scotland, transporting energy from where it is generated to where it is needed, providing a safe and reliable supply of electricity to the communities it serves. Home to some of the UK's greatest resources of renewable energy, SSEN Transmission is playing a critical role in the transition to a low carbon future, developing, building, maintaining and operating a network for net zero.

We offer an excellent package with 34 days annual leave entitlement. Enhanced maternity/paternity leave, discounted healthcare, salary sacrifice car leasing and much more, view our full benefits package on our careers site.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
brightsolid
Closing Date: 14/02/2024
  • Dundee/Aberdeen
  • Brightsolid

Job Description

About Brightsolid

Put simply, we help our customers get the right mix of cloud services they need to power their business. Our managed hybrid cloud services are unique in Scotland; combining private cloud and colocation from our data centres in Aberdeen and Dundee, with public cloud services from AWS. With 25 years of experience, we’re a first choice as trusted advisors to help Scotland’s public and private sector take full advantage of the potential and benefits of the cloud. This breadth of solution and level of experience sets us apart from other companies. We put our customers first, always. Our skilled and highly certified team pride ourselves on building strong relationships and getting cloud right for our customers – every time.

Overview

Senior Cloud Engineers sit within the Cloud Engineering team and work closely with Technical Support, NetOps, CyberOps, Projects and Product Managers to provide outstanding service to customers, ensuring platforms delivered and managed by Brightsolid are highly available and fit for purpose.

We provide fast, resilient, reliable environments and solutions with elevated levels of service availability. The role requires a flexible, can-do approach and offers the opportunity to learn on the job and to expand technical skills through training, study, and certification.

For this role you will have a strong background in Amazon Web Services and an evolving understanding of either Microsoft Azure or VMware.

You will be a leader within the organisation ensuring our customer solutions are architected appropriately while supporting the ongoing operation of our critical infrastructure solutions.

As a Senior Engineer you will embrace a modern infrastructure-as-code practice and ensure the extended engineering team have the appropriate skills and knowledge required to support our customer platforms.

We aim to provide a varied set of self-service capabilities to our customers, available through the AWS and Azure Marketplace, supporting customer needs across multiple environments which you will shape, deploy, and continuously improve.

Responsibilities

  • Technically lead from the front, as an AWS cloud engineer subject matter expert
  • Work with leadership to identify, test and champion the adoption of emerging technologies
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance through coaching and mentoring and provide specialist support to maintain the stability, functionality, and integrity of AWS platforms
  • Ensure that security, stability, and capacity are embedded in the development and deployment of services
  • Assist with the development of medium-to-long-term strategies for products and services
  • Act on the principle that “what can be automated should be automated
  • Assist in shaping career paths, recruiting the right talent and promoting best practice across knowledge share
  • Work with the Head of Cloud Engineering and others to identify skills gaps within technical teams
  • Act as a point of escalation for on-call engineers and participate in the engineering on-call rota as required

Essential Skills

  • AWS Professional certifications (Solutions Architect and/or DevOps Engineer) and knowledge of AWS best practices
  • Expert knowledge of one or more programming languages (e.g. Python) and continuous integration / delivery approaches and tools (e.g. GitHub)
  • In-depth knowledge of the design and development of applications on AWS
  • Adept at leveraging automation to improve development processes and optimise software delivery
  • Effective communication skills to be able to gather and interpret requirements and communicate results
  • Comfortable engaging with customers and prospects along with evangelising both Brightsolid and AWS service propositions
  • Ability to breakdown and solve complex technical problems across multiple technology domains

Desired Skills

  • AWS Specialty certifications
  • Containerisation (Docker/Docker Compose)
  • Monitoring platforms (Zabbix, Datadog)
  • ITSM platforms (ServiceNow)
  • Experience configuring and deploying multi-tenanted and dedicated private cloud infrastructures.
  • Strong experience and knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems
  • Strong experience of Backup systems.
  • Experience in Disaster Recovery and backup technologies at scale e.g. Zerto, Veeam, etc.
  • Experience working with Storage Array Networks and associated protocols.
  • Ability to apply strong technical, financial, and commercial considerations to all areas of work.
  • Expert knowledge of modern architectures and the toolchains required to effectively deploy and operate cloud solutions at scale.
  • Expert knowledge of TCP/IP and network troubleshooting
  • Enthusiasm and passion for using hybrid cloud platforms and high levels of automation to help our customers build new innovative services using tools such as Terraform and Salt.
  • Apply quality standards to all tasks undertaken and ensure that nothing is overlooked.
  • Identifying technical risk throughout the project delivery and into service delivery/ business as usual activity (BAU).
  • Knowledge of project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Prince II)
  • Knowledge of IT Service Management best practice (ITIL, ISO20000)
  • Knowledge of ISO standards (9000, 14000, 22301, 27001)

Behaviours

  • Able and willing to work to the Brightsolid values
  • Customer focused, “can do” attitude
  • Adapts communication style to suit the needs and understanding of the audience and situation
  • Respects the views and actions of others, appropriately challenging as required
  • Develops good working relationships with colleagues
  • Shows commitment to their team, seen as helpful and approachable by colleagues
  • Monitors progress against objectives, taking appropriate action to deliver results
  • Consistently meets deadlines and delivers against commitments
  • Draws on experience and knowledge to solve problems
  • Offers constructive ideas to help resolve problems and deliver solutions
  • Seeks guidance to help inform and support decision-making
  • Takes responsibility for own personal and career development, developing technical competence
  • Prepared to take on challenges

Working Pattern: We operate a hybrid working policy, with an expected minimum of 2 days per week in the office.

At Brightsolid, we’re excited to welcome individuals who share our passion for cloud technology and our commitment to customer success. If you’re ready to embark on a rewarding career journey in customer success, we encourage you to join our team and be a part of our mission to empower businesses in their cloud adoption journey.

To apply for this role, please follow our online application process and submit a CV and cover letter.

This is a full-time, permanent position, working 35 hours per week from Brightsolid’s Dundee or Aberdeen office. The role presents the opportunity for hybrid working that must include regular office attendance. We offer a generous package including 34 days holiday, health cash plan, excellent pension, a competitive salary, and many more staff discounts and benefits.

We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from everyone and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or any other protected characteristics.

If you have any issues with your application, please email recruitment@dcthomson.co.uk

Please note that we reserve the right to close the vacancy early once we have received suitable applications. Therefore, please ensure you submit your application as early as possible to avoid disappointment.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
About NCR Atleos
NCR Atleos, headquartered in Atlanta, is a leader in expanding financial access. Our dedicated 20,000 employees optimize the branch, improve operational efficiency and maximize self-service availability for financial institutions and retailers across the globe.
Position: Cloud Site Reliability Engineer
Location: Dundee, UK
NCR Atleos (NYSE: NATL) is a global technology company creating exceptional self-service banking experiences. We offer all the services, software and hardware solutions needed for a comprehensive self-service channel. NCR Atleos (www.ncratleos.com) is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia.
Come join our Cloud Platform Engineering team as a Senior Cloud SRE. You will develop, maintain, and enforce cloud adoption standards through an "infrastructure as code" approach towards the provisioning of cloud resources by engineering and solutions teams. You will leverage your leadership experience and technical acumen to help Cloud Platform Engineering realize a vision of empowering software engineering and solution teams to efficiently and reliably deliver and support their solutions to cloud platforms.
If you are passionate about quality and delivering awesome results for customers, come join us now!
People describe you as:
  • Positive, even in the face of adversity
  • Eager, endlessly curious and a born problem-solver
  • Agile—you welcome change; you thrive on it
  • Innovative; able to envision what isn’t there yet and navigate road-blocks in your way
  • A can-do, go-getter who wants to make things happen
You have:
  • A love and appreciation for process
  • Solid communication skills
  • Teamwork on your mind—even when colleagues are miles away
  • Motivation to learn and succeed
Key Responsibilities
This is a highly technical individual contributor role that comes with high degree of visibility.
  • Design and implement reusable Infrastructure As Code that will be used to deploy highly-available applications in the cloud
  • Implement and Manage IAC orchestration with a Kubernetes-based Jenkins/Ansible/Terraform stack
  • Collaborate with Observability team to ensure SLI/SLO is defined and met for dependent cloud resources
  • Design and implement reusable scripts/applications that will be used to automate tasks and reduce toil
  • Level 4 cloud infrastructure support
Core Competencies
  • Leadership/ownership mindset
  • Continuous learning
  • Set and exceed objectives; overcome obstacles; adapt quickly to change
  • Effectively manage and prioritize work; demonstrate personal initiative
  • Effectively listen, to understand needs and expectations; technical and non-technical audiences
  • Effectively communicate and build relationships with resources in varying roles and locations: architects, engineering, operations, support, management
  • Develop and execute creative ideas/solutions
  • Apply sound reasoning; complex problem-solving
  • Effectively collaborate and drive team excellence
Required Skills/Experience:
  • Advanced/Expert knowledge and experience with Terraform, particularly reusable common modules
  • Advanced/Expert knowledge and experience with common DevOps tools, specifically Jenkins and Ansible for IAC orchestration
  • Advanced/Expert knowledge and/or experience working with Google Cloud
  • Experience with cloud-based CI/CD Pipeline development, particularly GitHub Actions
  • Experience operating, supporting, and troubleshooting complex mission-critical applications on a cloud platform
  • Advanced knowledge and/or experience with kubernetes, particular GKE.
  • Working/Advanced knowledge and/or experience with common DevOps/SRE languages, like python or Go.
  • Experience following modern IT practices influencing Change, Configuration, Release and/or development
  • Experience with industry standard SRE/DevOps technologies (e.g. GitHub, Terraform, Artifactory, Ansible, Helm, CI/CD Pipeline tools, etc)
  • Experience working with DevOps/SRE principles & Agile (Scrum) methodologies; general understanding of both
  • Capable of technical deep dives into cloud-based infrastructure, databases, and application, specifically in designing, coding, operating, and supporting high-performance, highly available services
  • 8+ years equivalent, hands-on, experience
Preferred Skills/Experience:
  • Previous experience in a technical lead or senior role
  • Working/Advanced knowledge and/or experience with Azure Cloud
  • Advanced/Expert knowledge and experience with Github
  • Professional experience migrating workloads between cloud providers
  • experience in utilizing modern operations tools like ServiceNow, Dynatrace, AppDynamics, Splunk and similar.
  • Professional experience and success creating and maintaining standardized containers
  • Experience implementing and supporting modern GitOps IAC tooling, like Crossplane, Spacelift, Terraform controllers in Flux or Argo
  • Professional experience configuring and managing Kubernetes, particularly GKE and AKS.
  • Professional experience working in regulated environments (PCI)

title: Software Architect
description:
Position: Software Architect

Location: Dundee, UK

About NCR Atleos
NCR Atleos (NYSE: NATL) is a global technology company creating exceptional self-service banking experiences. We offer all of the services, software and hardware solutions needed for a comprehensive self-service channel. NCR Atleos (www.ncratleos.com) is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia.

Position Summary

You are passionate about technology, best practice, and good design. Everywhere you look, there’s possibility, opportunity, boundaries to push, and challenges to solve.

Your solutions result in clean architecture and design leading to high quality, feature rich solutions. You enjoy working closely with highly skilled development teams to build out your vision. You don’t see problems; instead, aided by your strong technical and testing skills, you see boundaries to push and challenges to solve. You understand the benefits of reuse and open-source software to decrease time to market. You are on top of trends throughout the industry and are always looking for how they can improve our solutions.

You will be joining the NCR Atleos Software Engineering organization, working directly with the Vice President of Software Architecture, other architects, and several software development teams that build our go-to-market products. In this role, you will be key in defining, promoting, implementing, and overseeing key architectural standards and frameworks that enable business success and ensure the scalability, maintainability, and reliability of our products.

Curious? Read on. We’re looking for a Software Architect like you.

Position responsibilities:

  • Working with other senior Software Engineering leads, SMEs, and architects to determine the appropriate architectures, technologies, and tooling to use.
  • Articulating the Non-Functional Requirements (NFRs) and architecting the solutions and standards to meet those NFRs.
  • Help to define, promote, and maintain architectural standards that are leveraged across development teams, and that support the cloud and on-prem products they build.
  • Produce and maintain architectural artifacts including diagrams & presentations.
  • Manage and prioritize architectural and technical backlogs.
  • Be ‘hands-on’, assisting teams by:
  • Guiding on adopting and implementing best practices and architectural standards.
  • Reviewing the teams’ designs and implementations to ensure alignment with the approved architecture.
  • Providing ongoing technical guidance to team members as required.
  • Helping to troubleshoot issues in production.
  • Working with QA specialists to ensure adequate automated, performance, and resilience testing.
  • Working with DevOps & SRE specialists to create and enhance our build, deployment, and operational monitoring capabilities.
  • Working with NCR Atleos Professional Services, other stakeholders, and end Customers to understand end user pain points, requirements, and solution architectures.
  • Meeting with stakeholders to clearly communicate status, issues, and options.
  • Feeding into project planning, product roadmaps, and prioritization activities.
  • Keep abreast of emerging trends, architecture and design patterns, software development practices, tools, and technologies.
  • Be seen as a technical leader that fosters a culture of support, best practice, excellence, openness, and continuous improvement.

Basic Requirements

  • A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • 5+ years of leading architecture & designs for high-transaction processing systems.
  • 3+ year of working with Microservices, Dockers, Kubernetes in public cloud environments.
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms, ideally Azure, Google Cloud Platform, or AWS.
  • Java, Spring, or .NET Core Cloud development experience.
  • Experience designing and implementing micro-service architecture.
  • Experience articulating NFRs and architecting the solution to meet them in conjunction with business/product and engineering teams.
  • Experience working in a scrum, agile project.
  • Experience leading design of new projects.
  • Experience evaluating, selecting, and coordinating technology choices.
  • Strong analytic and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent presentation skills.

Preferred Requirements

  • Experience working in a Scaled Agile environment, such as SAFe and supporting a multi-scrum team development project.
  • Certification in one or more cloud technologies.
  • Experience working with high volume transaction systems.
  • Experience with developing software for Financial Institutions.
  • Experience with compliance standards such as PCI and SOX.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £55,000.00-£85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Employee discount
  • Free parking
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Private medical insurance
  • Referral programme

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Yearly bonus

Experience:

  • Software development: 3 years (preferred)

Work authorisation:

  • United Kingdom (required)

Ability to Commute:

  • Dundee, DD2 4SW (preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

  • Dundee, DD2 4SW: Relocate before starting work (preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Dundee, DD2 4SW

title: Software Architect
description:
About NCR Atleos
NCR Atleos, headquartered in Atlanta, is a leader in expanding financial access. Our dedicated 20,000 employees optimize the branch, improve operational efficiency and maximize self-service availability for financial institutions and retailers across the globe.
Title: Application Security Architect
Location: Dundee, Scotland
Summary:
In this mission critical role as an Application Security Architect, you will serve as the AppSec technical lead for global, enterprise-wide applications and services. You will be part of a dynamic global application security team, working directly with software architects and software engineers to establish, enable, and improve the security of the software solutions developed within the company.
With NCR Atleos you’ll work in a fast-paced environment, helping enable teams to work in an SRE-driven operating model in a world of containers, automated pipelines, and rapid deployments. You’ll be instrumental in securing applications and services in a cloud and on-prem environments. NCR Atleos produces software for major companies in ATM Banking – come help secure the state-of-the-art!
Position responsibilities:
  • Work as the lead to design, implement and govern the overall security architecture of NCR Atleos products.
  • Manage security considerations for both cloud-native applications and the transition of SaaS on-prem applications to private cloud environments.
  • Aligning the secure development lifecycle to industry standards, including Microsoft SDL, OWASP development guides, and Privacy/PII related topics (privacy-by-design).
  • Integrate/enable security engineering automation (e.g. SAST, IAST) in the delivery pipeline.
  • Perform proof-of-concept and proof-of-technology testing for integrating new 3rd party security products into the development and deployment processes.
  • Lead threat modeling, design reviews, and code reviews as part of the development lifecycle.
  • Participate in application pen testing and remediation efforts with engineering teams.
  • Design and deploy state-of-art technology to meet the business needs and interface with business units regarding technical planning and application security topics.
  • Lead the implementation of proposed solutions while interfacing with the Project Management Office (PMO) to ensure the coordination, communication and successful delivery of projects.
  • Develop and maintain security procedures and guidelines for NCR Atleos products.
  • Manage relationships and interactions with human resources, legal, customers, and internal audit departments.
Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical discipline. Equivalent work experience will be considered.
  • Software development background of 4 -7 years.
  • Fluency in Java and .NET
  • Pipeline/CI/CD/automation experience
  • Experience with various cloud providers (GCP/Azure/OCI/AWS)
  • Container experience (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Experience with PCI, PA-DSS, and other audits (e.g., FFIEC, SOX)
  • Experience with privacy requirements of a global corporation (e.g. GDPR, CCPA)
  • Soft skills - effective communication (internal, customer, legal counsel), collaboration (internal, external) and effective written skills (white papers, vulnerability specifications etc.).
Preferred qualifications:
  • Security certifications, e.g. CISSP, CSSLP, CEH
  • Privacy training and certification, e.g. CIPT
  • Experience with retail, financial, and/or hospitality software, particularly the types of vulnerabilities and security testing associated with them.
  • Active participation in cybersecurity forums/conferences, e.g. DEFCON, Black Hat.

title: Programmer
description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Dundee is looking for talented developers whose skill set combines technical excellence with a passion for making games. As part of the Gameplay team you will be working on existing and implementing new gameplay systems to meet project design goals. You will be required to engage with a range of classic game programming areas such as AI, physics, animation, UI, and data management among others.

WHAT WE DO

  • Build core gameplay systems using a combination of code and script where appropriate.
  • We are proficient in both inter- and intra-studio communication, relying on and providing feedback to other teams, ultimately empowering us to create the immersive worlds we are known for.
  • Create the backbone upon which the design team authors our game's missions, random events, ambient life, and everything in between. Additionally, we create tools to facilitate said authoring, improve iteration times and increase the productivity of all teams, not just the design department.
  • We assume responsibility for programming the design team's systems, creating code which is often complex and intricate – both for single player and online content. That responsibility also extends to analyzing and optimizing code created by colleagues.
  • Our ability to implement design centric systems directly allows us to quickly iterate on new features and ideas, often with little to no dependence on other code departments.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work with the design and content teams to architect, engineer, and implement new features and systems which facilitate the creation of exciting new gameplay experiences.
  • Liaise with multiple departments and studios to create and/or extend our gameplay systems.
  • Working to strict deadlines and scoping work appropriately to deliver the quality we are known for.
  • Reacting to design changes and related feedback with thought out solutions and effective planning to achieve the goals.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • A Computer Science or Game Design degree with a programming focus is considered an advantage. However, relevant experience is taken into consideration.

SKILLS

  • Experience with C/C++ programming (VC14 preferable).
  • Experience with C# programming.
  • A strong understanding of top-down design, object-oriented programming, design patterns, and game design principles.
  • Excellent communication, technical & problem-solving skills.
  • Highly organized with proven ability to deliver on deadlines.
  • Passionate about gameplay, system design, and methodologies that will support a team that is similarly passionate about creating games.
  • Candidates must be highly motivated, positive and personable, with the ability to work as part of a team.
  • Adaptable and ability to multi-task and prioritize work based on changing schedules and feedback/critiques.
  • Ability to architect, engineer, and implement clean and concise APIs.
  • Strong math skills, knowledge of vectors, matrices and linear algebra.

PLUSES

  • Prior experience working in medium to large sized development teams.
  • At least one shipped title; preferably on the Xbox and/or Playstation consoles.
  • Experience of game design/scripting in a professional environment.
  • Online portfolio of previous work (code samples strongly advised).
  • Experience working with AI for action/multiplayer games.
  • In-depth familiarity of Rockstar products is a massive plus.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a resume and cover-letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. Please make sure to include examples of your work with code samples. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar Games recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.

title: Summer Placements - Corporate IT
description:
IT Summer Placements - Corporate IT

Duration: 12 weeks commencing June 2024

Location: see below for each placement

Salary: Circa £23,422 per annum pro rata

What is the role?

We have ambitious net zero targets, and our business is growing to help us achieve our strategy. We're looking for students who can bring fresh ideas, new skills and creative thinking, to deliver innovative solutions to help us reach net zero. This is an exciting time to join SSE, you have the power to make a change and help us build a better, more sustainable world of energy for you, your family, the community you live in and for generations to come.

What do I need?

We have opportunities for those studying degrees inclusive of software development and/or technology innovation. Please see each placement for the degree discipline, year group and location.

We'd love you to have some practical work or project experience that reflects your passion for the energy sector, as well as demonstrable experience of working in a team. About our Business

SSE IT underpins the technology needs of all the different businesses that make up the SSE group. From emerging technologies to data and analytics to cyber security - we power SSE's growth and enable it to generate value, while keeping it secure. As a trusted business partner that helps SSE lead in a low carbon world, we are proud of our service. Working for SSE IT is all about equipping SSE for now and the future.

Emerging Technology Team: Software Developer

Location–remote but able to reach Havant, Reading, London or Perth for regular meetings once or twice a month

Degree discipline: Software Engineering / Computer Science / Engineering (would also consider Data and AI/Analytics/Machine Learning/ Data Science) preferred year of study: Year 2 or 3

The Emerging Technologies Team is a small team tasked with exploring new technologies such as Mixed Reality, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Internet of Things (IoT) and the Metaverse. They embrace a mixture of programming languages, tools, and platforms to deliver this capability.

You will participate in assessing the feasibility, capabilities, process and operability of new technologies, techniques, and products.

You will assist in re-purposing existing technologies, techniques, and products and assist in building proof of concepts.

You will be involved in elements of analysis, programming / software development, system design, database design and research.

This is a great opportunity for a motivated individual eager to learn and be at the forefront of emerging technologies.

Cyber Resilience Team - Distribution TD&D - Analyst

Location–remote but able to reach Havant, Reading, London or Perth for regular meetings once or twice a month

Degree discipline: Computer Studies (or similar) preferred year of study: final

Working in the Cyber Security Programme, conduct a study on the varying education requirements for cyber security across the Distribution workforce, and suggest appropriate learning methods and ways to measure their effectiveness.

Energy Customer Solutions IT - IT Architecture Support

Location - Reading or Dublin

Degree discipline: Computer Studies, Computer Science - preferred year of study any

The IT Architecture Support role is responsible for assisting the IT Architecture team in delivering and maintaining the IT architecture vision, roadmap, and baseline for the organization. The role involves working closely with the IT Architecture Lead and other IT architects to manage the architecture backlog, ensure alignment with the strategic roadmap, and produce high-quality architecture deliverables and visions. It also includes involves collaborating across the multiple disciplines of IT Architecture, such as Data, Security, and Technology.

The main duties of the IT Architecture support role include; Architecture Backlog Management, Baseline Management, Strategic Roadmap, Architecture Deliverables and Visions and stakeholder management responsibilities.

title: Project Manager
description:
About the Role

Base Location: Aberdeen, Inverness or Perth

Salary: £45,400 - £68,200 + car /car allowance + performance-related bonus + a range of benefits to support your finances, wellbeing and family.

Working Pattern: Permanent | Full Time | Flexible First options available

The Eastern Green Link Programme is a multi-billion pound Programme currently comprised of two projects (Eastern Green Link 2 enters execution and Eastern Green Link 3 is pre construction), both of which are being delivered via Joint Venture with National Grid. Both projects are focusing on the development of Eastern HVDC Subsea Links which will connect Scotland and England to support the transfer of renewable electricity to key UK centres of demand. This will be the largest programme of work that SSEN Transmission will be involved in over the next decade.

The key duties and responsibilities of the Project Manager – Digital Services are:

  • Drive the definition and design of a holistic 'To-be' Operating Model for SSENT and NGET Joint Ventures, covering systems, processes and people.
  • Support the development and maintenance of an 'As-Is' systems architecture, which clearly articulates how both organisations are integrated.
  • Develop and rollout a delivery roadmap, which clearly articulates how the 'To-Be' integrated Operating Model will be designed and implemented, including Change Management deliverables.
  • Engage support functions (including IT) within both organisations to understand their current delivery roadmap and factor in Eastern Green Link project requirements and identify any project capability gaps and work with the project team and support functions to design and implement acceptable interim solutions.
  • Support the Head of Project Services in ensuring the Joint Venture Operating Model meets all Regulatory, IT Security etc. requirements, as defined by both parent organisations and drive alignment with internal governance processes and ensure any Operating Model solutions are signed off by relevant stakeholders.

What do I need?

To be considered for this role, we would love you to have:

  • Strong Project Management experience, particularly with an IT/systems focus and experience of Agile methodologies.
  • Experience in the design and implementation of large scale operating models.
  • Experience within the Transmission industry.
  • Strong stakeholder and communications experience and proven ability to manage multi-disciplinary teams (e.g. solution architects, IT Security).
  • Ability to work in fast paced environments, to pressurised deadlines and ability to navigate uncertain/changing requirements.

About our Business

SSEN Transmission owns and operates the electricity transmission network in the north of Scotland, transporting energy from where it is generated to where it is needed, providing a safe and reliable supply of electricity to the communities it serves. Home to some of the UK's greatest resources of renewable energy, SSEN Transmission is playing a critical role in the transition to a low carbon future, developing, building, maintaining and operating a network for net zero.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
brightsolid
Closing Date: 14/02/2024
  • Dundee/Aberdeen
  • Brightsolid

Job Description

About Brightsolid

Put simply, we help our customers get the right mix of cloud services they need to power their business. Our managed hybrid cloud services are unique in Scotland; combining private cloud and colocation from our data centres in Aberdeen and Dundee, with public cloud services from AWS. With 25 years of experience, we’re a first choice as trusted advisors to help Scotland’s public and private sector take full advantage of the potential and benefits of the cloud. This breadth of solution and level of experience sets us apart from other companies. We put our customers first, always. Our skilled and highly certified team pride ourselves on building strong relationships and getting cloud right for our customers – every time.

Overview

Senior Cloud Engineers sit within the Cloud Engineering team and work closely with Technical Support, NetOps, CyberOps, Projects and Product Managers to provide outstanding service to customers, ensuring platforms delivered and managed by Brightsolid are highly available and fit for purpose.

We provide fast, resilient, reliable environments and solutions with elevated levels of service availability. The role requires a flexible, can-do approach and offers the opportunity to learn on the job and to expand technical skills through training, study, and certification.

For this role you will have a strong background in Amazon Web Services and an evolving understanding of either Microsoft Azure or VMware.

You will be a leader within the organisation ensuring our customer solutions are architected appropriately while supporting the ongoing operation of our critical infrastructure solutions.

As a Senior Engineer you will embrace a modern infrastructure-as-code practice and ensure the extended engineering team have the appropriate skills and knowledge required to support our customer platforms.

We aim to provide a varied set of self-service capabilities to our customers, available through the AWS and Azure Marketplace, supporting customer needs across multiple environments which you will shape, deploy, and continuously improve.

Responsibilities

  • Technically lead from the front, as an AWS cloud engineer subject matter expert
  • Work with leadership to identify, test and champion the adoption of emerging technologies
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance through coaching and mentoring and provide specialist support to maintain the stability, functionality, and integrity of AWS platforms
  • Ensure that security, stability, and capacity are embedded in the development and deployment of services
  • Assist with the development of medium-to-long-term strategies for products and services
  • Act on the principle that “what can be automated should be automated
  • Assist in shaping career paths, recruiting the right talent and promoting best practice across knowledge share
  • Work with the Head of Cloud Engineering and others to identify skills gaps within technical teams
  • Act as a point of escalation for on-call engineers and participate in the engineering on-call rota as required

Essential Skills

  • AWS Professional certifications (Solutions Architect and/or DevOps Engineer) and knowledge of AWS best practices
  • Expert knowledge of one or more programming languages (e.g. Python) and continuous integration / delivery approaches and tools (e.g. GitHub)
  • In-depth knowledge of the design and development of applications on AWS
  • Adept at leveraging automation to improve development processes and optimise software delivery
  • Effective communication skills to be able to gather and interpret requirements and communicate results
  • Comfortable engaging with customers and prospects along with evangelising both Brightsolid and AWS service propositions
  • Ability to breakdown and solve complex technical problems across multiple technology domains

Desired Skills

  • AWS Specialty certifications
  • Containerisation (Docker/Docker Compose)
  • Monitoring platforms (Zabbix, Datadog)
  • ITSM platforms (ServiceNow)
  • Experience configuring and deploying multi-tenanted and dedicated private cloud infrastructures.
  • Strong experience and knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems
  • Strong experience of Backup systems.
  • Experience in Disaster Recovery and backup technologies at scale e.g. Zerto, Veeam, etc.
  • Experience working with Storage Array Networks and associated protocols.
  • Ability to apply strong technical, financial, and commercial considerations to all areas of work.
  • Expert knowledge of modern architectures and the toolchains required to effectively deploy and operate cloud solutions at scale.
  • Expert knowledge of TCP/IP and network troubleshooting
  • Enthusiasm and passion for using hybrid cloud platforms and high levels of automation to help our customers build new innovative services using tools such as Terraform and Salt.
  • Apply quality standards to all tasks undertaken and ensure that nothing is overlooked.
  • Identifying technical risk throughout the project delivery and into service delivery/ business as usual activity (BAU).
  • Knowledge of project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Prince II)
  • Knowledge of IT Service Management best practice (ITIL, ISO20000)
  • Knowledge of ISO standards (9000, 14000, 22301, 27001)

Behaviours

  • Able and willing to work to the Brightsolid values
  • Customer focused, “can do” attitude
  • Adapts communication style to suit the needs and understanding of the audience and situation
  • Respects the views and actions of others, appropriately challenging as required
  • Develops good working relationships with colleagues
  • Shows commitment to their team, seen as helpful and approachable by colleagues
  • Monitors progress against objectives, taking appropriate action to deliver results
  • Consistently meets deadlines and delivers against commitments
  • Draws on experience and knowledge to solve problems
  • Offers constructive ideas to help resolve problems and deliver solutions
  • Seeks guidance to help inform and support decision-making
  • Takes responsibility for own personal and career development, developing technical competence
  • Prepared to take on challenges

Working Pattern: We operate a hybrid working policy, with an expected minimum of 2 days per week in the office.

At Brightsolid, we’re excited to welcome individuals who share our passion for cloud technology and our commitment to customer success. If you’re ready to embark on a rewarding career journey in customer success, we encourage you to join our team and be a part of our mission to empower businesses in their cloud adoption journey.

To apply for this role, please follow our online application process and submit a CV and cover letter.

This is a full-time, permanent position, working 35 hours per week from Brightsolid’s Dundee or Aberdeen office. The role presents the opportunity for hybrid working that must include regular office attendance. We offer a generous package including 34 days holiday, health cash plan, excellent pension, a competitive salary, and many more staff discounts and benefits.

We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from everyone and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or any other protected characteristics.

If you have any issues with your application, please email recruitment@dcthomson.co.uk

Please note that we reserve the right to close the vacancy early once we have received suitable applications. Therefore, please ensure you submit your application as early as possible to avoid disappointment.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
About NCR Atleos
NCR Atleos, headquartered in Atlanta, is a leader in expanding financial access. Our dedicated 20,000 employees optimize the branch, improve operational efficiency and maximize self-service availability for financial institutions and retailers across the globe.
Position: Cloud Site Reliability Engineer
Location: Dundee, UK
NCR Atleos (NYSE: NATL) is a global technology company creating exceptional self-service banking experiences. We offer all the services, software and hardware solutions needed for a comprehensive self-service channel. NCR Atleos (www.ncratleos.com) is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia.
Come join our Cloud Platform Engineering team as a Senior Cloud SRE. You will develop, maintain, and enforce cloud adoption standards through an "infrastructure as code" approach towards the provisioning of cloud resources by engineering and solutions teams. You will leverage your leadership experience and technical acumen to help Cloud Platform Engineering realize a vision of empowering software engineering and solution teams to efficiently and reliably deliver and support their solutions to cloud platforms.
If you are passionate about quality and delivering awesome results for customers, come join us now!
People describe you as:
  • Positive, even in the face of adversity
  • Eager, endlessly curious and a born problem-solver
  • Agile—you welcome change; you thrive on it
  • Innovative; able to envision what isn’t there yet and navigate road-blocks in your way
  • A can-do, go-getter who wants to make things happen
You have:
  • A love and appreciation for process
  • Solid communication skills
  • Teamwork on your mind—even when colleagues are miles away
  • Motivation to learn and succeed
Key Responsibilities
This is a highly technical individual contributor role that comes with high degree of visibility.
  • Design and implement reusable Infrastructure As Code that will be used to deploy highly-available applications in the cloud
  • Implement and Manage IAC orchestration with a Kubernetes-based Jenkins/Ansible/Terraform stack
  • Collaborate with Observability team to ensure SLI/SLO is defined and met for dependent cloud resources
  • Design and implement reusable scripts/applications that will be used to automate tasks and reduce toil
  • Level 4 cloud infrastructure support
Core Competencies
  • Leadership/ownership mindset
  • Continuous learning
  • Set and exceed objectives; overcome obstacles; adapt quickly to change
  • Effectively manage and prioritize work; demonstrate personal initiative
  • Effectively listen, to understand needs and expectations; technical and non-technical audiences
  • Effectively communicate and build relationships with resources in varying roles and locations: architects, engineering, operations, support, management
  • Develop and execute creative ideas/solutions
  • Apply sound reasoning; complex problem-solving
  • Effectively collaborate and drive team excellence
Required Skills/Experience:
  • Advanced/Expert knowledge and experience with Terraform, particularly reusable common modules
  • Advanced/Expert knowledge and experience with common DevOps tools, specifically Jenkins and Ansible for IAC orchestration
  • Advanced/Expert knowledge and/or experience working with Google Cloud
  • Experience with cloud-based CI/CD Pipeline development, particularly GitHub Actions
  • Experience operating, supporting, and troubleshooting complex mission-critical applications on a cloud platform
  • Advanced knowledge and/or experience with kubernetes, particular GKE.
  • Working/Advanced knowledge and/or experience with common DevOps/SRE languages, like python or Go.
  • Experience following modern IT practices influencing Change, Configuration, Release and/or development
  • Experience with industry standard SRE/DevOps technologies (e.g. GitHub, Terraform, Artifactory, Ansible, Helm, CI/CD Pipeline tools, etc)
  • Experience working with DevOps/SRE principles & Agile (Scrum) methodologies; general understanding of both
  • Capable of technical deep dives into cloud-based infrastructure, databases, and application, specifically in designing, coding, operating, and supporting high-performance, highly available services
  • 8+ years equivalent, hands-on, experience
Preferred Skills/Experience:
  • Previous experience in a technical lead or senior role
  • Working/Advanced knowledge and/or experience with Azure Cloud
  • Advanced/Expert knowledge and experience with Github
  • Professional experience migrating workloads between cloud providers
  • experience in utilizing modern operations tools like ServiceNow, Dynatrace, AppDynamics, Splunk and similar.
  • Professional experience and success creating and maintaining standardized containers
  • Experience implementing and supporting modern GitOps IAC tooling, like Crossplane, Spacelift, Terraform controllers in Flux or Argo
  • Professional experience configuring and managing Kubernetes, particularly GKE and AKS.
  • Professional experience working in regulated environments (PCI)

title: Software Architect
description:
Position: Software Architect

Location: Dundee, UK

About NCR Atleos
NCR Atleos (NYSE: NATL) is a global technology company creating exceptional self-service banking experiences. We offer all of the services, software and hardware solutions needed for a comprehensive self-service channel. NCR Atleos (www.ncratleos.com) is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia.

Position Summary

You are passionate about technology, best practice, and good design. Everywhere you look, there’s possibility, opportunity, boundaries to push, and challenges to solve.

Your solutions result in clean architecture and design leading to high quality, feature rich solutions. You enjoy working closely with highly skilled development teams to build out your vision. You don’t see problems; instead, aided by your strong technical and testing skills, you see boundaries to push and challenges to solve. You understand the benefits of reuse and open-source software to decrease time to market. You are on top of trends throughout the industry and are always looking for how they can improve our solutions.

You will be joining the NCR Atleos Software Engineering organization, working directly with the Vice President of Software Architecture, other architects, and several software development teams that build our go-to-market products. In this role, you will be key in defining, promoting, implementing, and overseeing key architectural standards and frameworks that enable business success and ensure the scalability, maintainability, and reliability of our products.

Curious? Read on. We’re looking for a Software Architect like you.

Position responsibilities:

  • Working with other senior Software Engineering leads, SMEs, and architects to determine the appropriate architectures, technologies, and tooling to use.
  • Articulating the Non-Functional Requirements (NFRs) and architecting the solutions and standards to meet those NFRs.
  • Help to define, promote, and maintain architectural standards that are leveraged across development teams, and that support the cloud and on-prem products they build.
  • Produce and maintain architectural artifacts including diagrams & presentations.
  • Manage and prioritize architectural and technical backlogs.
  • Be ‘hands-on’, assisting teams by:
  • Guiding on adopting and implementing best practices and architectural standards.
  • Reviewing the teams’ designs and implementations to ensure alignment with the approved architecture.
  • Providing ongoing technical guidance to team members as required.
  • Helping to troubleshoot issues in production.
  • Working with QA specialists to ensure adequate automated, performance, and resilience testing.
  • Working with DevOps & SRE specialists to create and enhance our build, deployment, and operational monitoring capabilities.
  • Working with NCR Atleos Professional Services, other stakeholders, and end Customers to understand end user pain points, requirements, and solution architectures.
  • Meeting with stakeholders to clearly communicate status, issues, and options.
  • Feeding into project planning, product roadmaps, and prioritization activities.
  • Keep abreast of emerging trends, architecture and design patterns, software development practices, tools, and technologies.
  • Be seen as a technical leader that fosters a culture of support, best practice, excellence, openness, and continuous improvement.

Basic Requirements

  • A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • 5+ years of leading architecture & designs for high-transaction processing systems.
  • 3+ year of working with Microservices, Dockers, Kubernetes in public cloud environments.
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms, ideally Azure, Google Cloud Platform, or AWS.
  • Java, Spring, or .NET Core Cloud development experience.
  • Experience designing and implementing micro-service architecture.
  • Experience articulating NFRs and architecting the solution to meet them in conjunction with business/product and engineering teams.
  • Experience working in a scrum, agile project.
  • Experience leading design of new projects.
  • Experience evaluating, selecting, and coordinating technology choices.
  • Strong analytic and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent presentation skills.

Preferred Requirements

  • Experience working in a Scaled Agile environment, such as SAFe and supporting a multi-scrum team development project.
  • Certification in one or more cloud technologies.
  • Experience working with high volume transaction systems.
  • Experience with developing software for Financial Institutions.
  • Experience with compliance standards such as PCI and SOX.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £55,000.00-£85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Employee discount
  • Free parking
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Private medical insurance
  • Referral programme

  • Monday to Friday

  • Dundee, DD2 4SW (preferred)

title: Software Architect
description:
About NCR Atleos
NCR Atleos, headquartered in Atlanta, is a leader in expanding financial access. Our dedicated 20,000 employees optimize the branch, improve operational efficiency and maximize self-service availability for financial institutions and retailers across the globe.
Title: Application Security Architect
Location: Dundee, Scotland
Summary:
In this mission critical role as an Application Security Architect, you will serve as the AppSec technical lead for global, enterprise-wide applications and services. You will be part of a dynamic global application security team, working directly with software architects and software engineers to establish, enable, and improve the security of the software solutions developed within the company.
With NCR Atleos you’ll work in a fast-paced environment, helping enable teams to work in an SRE-driven operating model in a world of containers, automated pipelines, and rapid deployments. You’ll be instrumental in securing applications and services in a cloud and on-prem environments. NCR Atleos produces software for major companies in ATM Banking – come help secure the state-of-the-art!
Position responsibilities:
  • Work as the lead to design, implement and govern the overall security architecture of NCR Atleos products.
  • Manage security considerations for both cloud-native applications and the transition of SaaS on-prem applications to private cloud environments.
  • Aligning the secure development lifecycle to industry standards, including Microsoft SDL, OWASP development guides, and Privacy/PII related topics (privacy-by-design).
  • Integrate/enable security engineering automation (e.g. SAST, IAST) in the delivery pipeline.
  • Perform proof-of-concept and proof-of-technology testing for integrating new 3rd party security products into the development and deployment processes.
  • Lead threat modeling, design reviews, and code reviews as part of the development lifecycle.
  • Participate in application pen testing and remediation efforts with engineering teams.
  • Design and deploy state-of-art technology to meet the business needs and interface with business units regarding technical planning and application security topics.
  • Lead the implementation of proposed solutions while interfacing with the Project Management Office (PMO) to ensure the coordination, communication and successful delivery of projects.
  • Develop and maintain security procedures and guidelines for NCR Atleos products.
  • Manage relationships and interactions with human resources, legal, customers, and internal audit departments.
Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical discipline. Equivalent work experience will be considered.
  • Software development background of 4 -7 years.
  • Fluency in Java and .NET
  • Pipeline/CI/CD/automation experience
  • Experience with various cloud providers (GCP/Azure/OCI/AWS)
  • Container experience (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Experience with PCI, PA-DSS, and other audits (e.g., FFIEC, SOX)
  • Experience with privacy requirements of a global corporation (e.g. GDPR, CCPA)
  • Soft skills - effective communication (internal, customer, legal counsel), collaboration (internal, external) and effective written skills (white papers, vulnerability specifications etc.).
Preferred qualifications:
  • Security certifications, e.g. CISSP, CSSLP, CEH
  • Privacy training and certification, e.g. CIPT
  • Experience with retail, financial, and/or hospitality software, particularly the types of vulnerabilities and security testing associated with them.
  • Active participation in cybersecurity forums/conferences, e.g. DEFCON, Black Hat.
Offers of employment are conditional upon passage of screening criteria applicable to the job.

title: Software Architect
description:
About NCR Atleos
NCR Atleos, headquartered in Atlanta, is a leader in expanding financial access. Our dedicated 20,000 employees optimize the branch, improve operational efficiency and maximize self-service availability for financial institutions and retailers across the globe.
Position: Software Architect
Location: Dundee, UK
About NCR Atleos
NCR Atleos (NYSE: NATL) is a global technology company creating exceptional self-service banking experiences. We offer all of the services, software and hardware solutions needed for a comprehensive self-service channel. NCR Atleos (
www.ncratleos.com
) is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia.
Position Summary
You are passionate about technology, best practice, and good design. Everywhere you look, there’s possibility, opportunity, boundaries to push, and challenges to solve.
Your solutions result in clean architecture and design leading to high quality, feature rich solutions. You enjoy working closely with highly skilled development teams to build out your vision. You don’t see problems; instead, aided by your strong technical and testing skills, you see boundaries to push and challenges to solve. You understand the benefits of reuse and open-source software to decrease time to market. You are on top of trends throughout the industry and are always looking for how they can improve our solutions.
You will be joining the NCR Atleos Software Engineering organization, working directly with the Vice President of Software Architecture, other architects, and several software development teams that build our go-to-market products. In this role, you will be key in defining, promoting, implementing, and overseeing key architectural standards and frameworks that enable business success and ensure the scalability, maintainability, and reliability of our products.
Curious? Read on. We’re looking for a Software Architect like you.
Position responsibilities:
  • Working with other senior Software Engineering leads, SMEs, and architects to determine the appropriate architectures, technologies, and tooling to use.
  • Articulating the Non-Functional Requirements (NFRs) and architecting the solutions and standards to meet those NFRs.
  • Help to define, promote, and maintain architectural standards that are leveraged across development teams, and that support the cloud and on-prem products they build.
  • Produce and maintain architectural artifacts including diagrams & presentations.
  • Manage and prioritize architectural and technical backlogs.
  • Be ‘hands-on’, assisting teams by:
    • Guiding on adopting and implementing best practices and architectural standards.
    • Reviewing the teams’ designs and implementations to ensure alignment with the approved architecture.
    • Providing ongoing technical guidance to team members as required.
    • Helping to troubleshoot issues in production.
    • Working with QA specialists to ensure adequate automated, performance, and resilience testing.
  • Working with DevOps & SRE specialists to create and enhance our build, deployment, and operational monitoring capabilities.
  • Working with NCR Atleos Professional Services, other stakeholders, and end Customers to understand end user pain points, requirements, and solution architectures.
  • Meeting with stakeholders to clearly communicate status, issues, and options.
  • Feeding into project planning, product roadmaps, and prioritization activities.
  • Keep abreast of emerging trends, architecture and design patterns, software development practices, tools, and technologies.
  • Be seen as a technical leader that fosters a culture of support, best practice, excellence, openness, and continuous improvement.
Basic Requirements
  • A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • 5+ years of leading architecture & designs for high-transaction processing systems.
  • 3+ year of working with Microservices, Dockers, Kubernetes in public cloud environments.
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms, ideally Azure, Google Cloud Platform, or AWS.
  • Java, Spring, or .NET Core Cloud development experience.
  • Experience designing and implementing micro-service architecture.
  • Experience articulating NFRs and architecting the solution to meet them in conjunction with business/product and engineering teams.
  • Experience working in a scrum, agile project.
  • Experience leading design of new projects.
  • Experience evaluating, selecting, and coordinating technology choices.
  • Strong analytic and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent presentation skills.
Preferred Requirements
  • Experience working in a Scaled Agile environment, such as SAFe and supporting a multi-scrum team development project.
  • Certification in one or more cloud technologies.
  • Experience working with high volume transaction systems.
  • Experience with developing software for Financial Institutions.
  • Experience with compliance standards such as PCI and SOX.

title: Programmer
description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Dundee is looking for talented developers whose skill set combines technical excellence with a passion for making games. As part of the Gameplay team you will be working on existing and implementing new gameplay systems to meet project design goals. You will be required to engage with a range of classic game programming areas such as AI, physics, animation, UI, and data management among others.

WHAT WE DO

  • Build core gameplay systems using a combination of code and script where appropriate.
  • We are proficient in both inter- and intra-studio communication, relying on and providing feedback to other teams, ultimately empowering us to create the immersive worlds we are known for.
  • Create the backbone upon which the design team authors our game's missions, random events, ambient life, and everything in between. Additionally, we create tools to facilitate said authoring, improve iteration times and increase the productivity of all teams, not just the design department.
  • We assume responsibility for programming the design team's systems, creating code which is often complex and intricate – both for single player and online content. That responsibility also extends to analyzing and optimizing code created by colleagues.
  • Our ability to implement design centric systems directly allows us to quickly iterate on new features and ideas, often with little to no dependence on other code departments.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work with the design and content teams to architect, engineer, and implement new features and systems which facilitate the creation of exciting new gameplay experiences.
  • Liaise with multiple departments and studios to create and/or extend our gameplay systems.
  • Working to strict deadlines and scoping work appropriately to deliver the quality we are known for.
  • Reacting to design changes and related feedback with thought out solutions and effective planning to achieve the goals.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • A Computer Science or Game Design degree with a programming focus is considered an advantage. However, relevant experience is taken into consideration.

SKILLS

  • Experience with C/C++ programming (VC14 preferable).
  • Experience with C# programming.
  • A strong understanding of top-down design, object-oriented programming, design patterns, and game design principles.
  • Excellent communication, technical & problem-solving skills.
  • Highly organized with proven ability to deliver on deadlines.
  • Passionate about gameplay, system design, and methodologies that will support a team that is similarly passionate about creating games.
  • Candidates must be highly motivated, positive and personable, with the ability to work as part of a team.
  • Adaptable and ability to multi-task and prioritize work based on changing schedules and feedback/critiques.
  • Ability to architect, engineer, and implement clean and concise APIs.
  • Strong math skills, knowledge of vectors, matrices and linear algebra.

PLUSES

  • Prior experience working in medium to large sized development teams.
  • At least one shipped title; preferably on the Xbox and/or Playstation consoles.
  • Experience of game design/scripting in a professional environment.
  • Online portfolio of previous work (code samples strongly advised).
  • Experience working with AI for action/multiplayer games.
  • In-depth familiarity of Rockstar products is a massive plus.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a resume and cover-letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. Please make sure to include examples of your work with code samples. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar Games recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.

title: Summer Placements - Corporate IT
description:
IT Summer Placements - Corporate IT

Duration: 12 weeks commencing June 2024

Location: see below for each placement

Salary: Circa £23,422 per annum pro rata

What is the role?

We have ambitious net zero targets, and our business is growing to help us achieve our strategy. We're looking for students who can bring fresh ideas, new skills and creative thinking, to deliver innovative solutions to help us reach net zero. This is an exciting time to join SSE, you have the power to make a change and help us build a better, more sustainable world of energy for you, your family, the community you live in and for generations to come.

What do I need?

We have opportunities for those studying degrees inclusive of software development and/or technology innovation. Please see each placement for the degree discipline, year group and location.

We'd love you to have some practical work or project experience that reflects your passion for the energy sector, as well as demonstrable experience of working in a team. You'll also be comfortable working to and setting stretching individual targets and using your own initiative to overcome challenges and should have a genuine interest in SSE and the prospect of a long-term future with us.

About our Business

SSE IT underpins the technology needs of all the different businesses that make up the SSE group. From emerging technologies to data and analytics to cyber security - we power SSE's growth and enable it to generate value, while keeping it secure. As a trusted business partner that helps SSE lead in a low carbon world, we are proud of our service. Working for SSE IT is all about equipping SSE for now and the future.

Emerging Technology Team: Software Developer

Location–remote but able to reach Havant, Reading, London or Perth for regular meetings once or twice a month

Degree discipline: Software Engineering / Computer Science / Engineering (would also consider Data and AI/Analytics/Machine Learning/ Data Science) preferred year of study: Year 2 or 3

The Emerging Technologies Team is a small team tasked with exploring new technologies such as Mixed Reality, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Internet of Things (IoT) and the Metaverse. They embrace a mixture of programming languages, tools, and platforms to deliver this capability.

You will participate in assessing the feasibility, capabilities, process and operability of new technologies, techniques, and products.

You will assist in re-purposing existing technologies, techniques, and products and assist in building proof of concepts.

You will be involved in elements of analysis, programming / software development, system design, database design and research.

This is a great opportunity for a motivated individual eager to learn and be at the forefront of emerging technologies.

Cyber Resilience Team - Distribution TD&D - Analyst

Location–remote but able to reach Havant, Reading, London or Perth for regular meetings once or twice a month

Degree discipline: Computer Studies (or similar) preferred year of study: final

Working in the Cyber Security Programme, conduct a study on the varying education requirements for cyber security across the Distribution workforce, and suggest appropriate learning methods and ways to measure their effectiveness.

Energy Customer Solutions IT - IT Architecture Support

Location - Reading or Dublin

Degree discipline: Computer Studies, Computer Science - preferred year of study any

The IT Architecture Support role is responsible for assisting the IT Architecture team in delivering and maintaining the IT architecture vision, roadmap, and baseline for the organization. The role involves working closely with the IT Architecture Lead and other IT architects to manage the architecture backlog, ensure alignment with the strategic roadmap, and produce high-quality architecture deliverables and visions. It also includes involves collaborating across the multiple disciplines of IT Architecture, such as Data, Security, and Technology.

The main duties of the IT Architecture support role include; Architecture Backlog Management, Baseline Management, Strategic Roadmap, Architecture Deliverables and Visions and stakeholder management responsibilities.

What's in it for you?

An excellent package with 34 days holiday entitlement - pro rata, discounted gym memberships and much more, view our full benefits package on our careers site.

As an equal opportunity employer we encourage diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We actively encourage applicants from all protected characteristics and commit to providing any reasonable adjustments required during the application, assessment and upon joining SSE. Search for ‘Inclusion & Diversity at SSE’ to find out more.

Next Steps

All applications should be submitted online. The closing date is 11pm on Sunday, 25th February.

If you would like to discuss any working differently requirements or adjustments you may require throughout the recruitment and selection process, please contact graduates@sse.com by email or you are very welcome to request a call if you would prefer to discuss on the phone.
